name: 3 MONTH MINI COMIC SUBSCRIPTION
description: October-December 2013 Only Become a Friend of Oily Comics for 3 months and get 5 mini comics per month plus bonus items. NEW LOW PRICE because Oily loves you. 3 Month Subscription: • Every mini-comic released between October-December 2013 (15 comics; 3 monthly shipments) • Some months I'll put other gifts like little postcard prints or risograph prints by an Oily cartoonist. •10% off of any orders from the Oily webstore (discount code will be emailed to you in July) •Option to add Nick Drnaso's Tell God to Blow the Wind from the West for 3 more dollars at no additional shipping charge! ***Extra shipping charge for overseas customers. Oily published comics by the following: Charles Forsman, Melissa Mendes, Max de Radigués, Aaron Cockle, Dane Martin, Andy Burkholder, Jessica Campbell, Warren Craghead III, Joseph Lambert, Marian Runk, Alex Kim, Zach Worton, Michael DeForge, Benjamin Urkowitz, Alex Kim, Josh Simmons, Billy Burkert, Dan Zettwoch and more.

name: Michel Fiffe Interview Zine
description: Sean Ford (Only Skin) interviews Michel Fiffe (Zegas, Copra) about work ethic, colors, genre comics, and self-publishing hustle. by Michel Fiffe and Sean Ford 4.25 x 5.5 12 pages Blue and White Excerpt: SF: So, a week to write, a week to pencil, a week to ink and a week to color? I could produce a monthly comic at that speed, but it'd probably only be four pages long. That's impressive. MF: I remember when making one page a week was monumental. Yeah, that schedule breaks down to drawing 4 pages a day. Inking 4 a day. Maybe 5 if the backgrounds can be colored in. It all overlaps. You know what helps? Not going online. That's something I had to struggle with, because as a self publisher, I still have to sell the work. I have to be on the ball in that regard, too. SF: Yeah, I think one thing a lot of people I know have had to try to make peace or come to terms with how they interact with the internet. On the one hand, it's great because a lot of the comics community is on twitter or facebook or whatever and right there to reach out to with technical questions, advice or like, instant validation for whatever new page or drawing you want to share. But there's the definite downside of having only so many hours in the day and the prospect of losing two hours to the void every night terrifies me a lot. And it happens all the time. MF: Right. So my schedule is a big mess of to-do lists. I'm also the person who processes the orders, stuffs the envelopes, makes sure I'm covering the costs, then it's back to drawing. Chuck Forsman does it, I'm sure he's developed a way to make it all move along, but it's a pretty intense routine. It had to be done, though. I had no other option.

name: Jo Dery Interview Zine
description: Jo Dery talks to Melissa Mendes about leaving home, growing up, teaching art, and wandering through the woods. by Jo Dery and Melissa Mendes 4.25 x 5.5 12 pages Black and White Excerpt: Mendes: So, you’re teaching now in Chicago, what’s that like? Do you feel a balance between teaching and your own work, or do you consider yourself mostly a teacher? Dery: Yeah, I totally hear ya. I’ve spent a lot of time trying to understand why you need to “leave home” in order to grow up -- perhaps it’s hard for you to see yourself as a new person in the eyes of those who have known you for so long? Perhaps it’s easier to change when you have a blank slate before you, and you don’t carry such long histories behind you.

name: S.R. BISSETTE'S TYRANT® IN SLUMBERLAND Print
description:
The adventures of S.R. BISSETTE'S TYRANT® continues in this new full-color print, TYRANT® IN SLUMBERLAND. Written and illustrated by Stephen R. Bissette, with eye-popping color & digital production by Charles Forsman (SNAKE OIL, SUNDAYS, THE END OF THE F**KING WORLD, etc.), this wild and woolly primordial poem comic adapts the renowned "Casey at the Bat" by Ernest Thayer into a delirious dino-dream delight! 

S.R. BISSETTE'S TYRANT® IN SLUMBERLAND limited edition color print 11 x 17" card stock full-color print by Stephen R. Bissette and Charles Forsman, signed & numbered (200 print run)—signed by both creators, mailed in a tube for sturdiest transit.

Signed 1st printing

***NOTICE: This print will start shipping May 9, 2012. Please be patient. It will get there. Thanks!

name: S.R. BISSETTE'S A-Z Zombie Print

Signed 1st printing

name: E.T./Garfield Mash-up Print
description: See a larger more readable version on my flickr. NOW SHIPPING I am offering a first signed and numbered printing of 100 which will start shipping the first week in March 2012. follow me on twitter for updates: @charlesforsman My third mash-up poster in which I take a movie and a newspaper strip and try to make them into one thing. My goal is to not tell the whole story but to give a taste of what it might have been like if the chosen cartoonist had drawn the film as a comic strip. This one is Garfield and E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial. 17"x11" (landscape) Digital Print on Heavy Stock Shipped in a heavy-duty mailing tube tube

name: JAWS/Peanuts Mash-up Print
description: If you place an order, I can't guarantee a you a print in time for Christmas 2013. Please be patient. See a larger more readable version on my flickr. After my Raiders/Popeye strip was so well received I decided to try another combination. This time it is 2 of my all-time favorites: Spielberg and Benchley's Jaws drawn like Schulz's Peanuts. Like the last mashup, this one does not try to tell the whole story but rather depict a some of my favorite scenes. 11"x17" Digital Print on Heavy Stock Shipped in a tube to avoid damage

name: Raiders of the Lost Ark/Popeye Print
description:
6 Strips of scenes from Raiders of the Lost Ark done in a Segar Popeye style.

11x17
digital print on heavy stock
shipped in a tube.
Please allow up to 2 weeks for delivery.
